bullets.text: U.S. government shutdown ends, but ICE funding fight persists, keeping fiscal and political uncertainty elevated.
U.S. fighter jet shoots down Iranian drone near aircraft carrier, signaling heightened Gulf tensions and potential shipping/energy risk premia.
Report flags possible fractures in China’s leadership tied to paranoia and power plays, raising policy unpredictability for markets and regional security.
Walmart hits $1 trillion market value, underscoring scale advantages and investor preference for cash-generative incumbents amid tech volatility.
Tech-led selloff drags the S&P 500; investors reassess AI winners versus disruption risk across software and adjacent credit exposures.
Oracle’s $25B debt financing highlights rising capital intensity and funding anxiety for AI infrastructure builds as rates and leverage matter again.
AMD drops on weaker-than-hoped forecast, reinforcing uneven chip demand expectations beyond top AI GPU beneficiaries.
Nvidia–OpenAI mega-deal appears stalled; both still rely on each other, signaling negotiation friction without reducing near-term compute dependence.
Gold breaks above $5,000 while bitcoin dips below $73,000, showing a risk-off tilt and renewed demand for perceived hard-asset hedges.
YC will allow founders to receive funding in stablecoins, nudging startup finance toward faster cross-border settlement and broader crypto rails adoption.
Europe pushes digital sovereignty: France dumps Zoom/Teams; French authorities raid X offices as scrutiny of U.S. platforms and AI tools intensifies.
Health officials warn neglected tropical diseases could resurge in Africa amid funding gaps, posing economic productivity and regional stability risks.
New catalyst converts CO2 into cleaner fuels, a potential step-change for decarbonization economics if scalable and energy-efficient in real-world systems.
